data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Prepare release 0.1.0 (#17)

* Add initial CHANGELOG
* 0.1.0

Signed-off-by: Emerson Knapp <emerson.b.knapp@gmail.com>

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Let all imports come from toplevel module, as one line (#16)

That way instead of

```
from launch_frontend_py import launch
from launch_frontend_py.actions import executable
```

A user only has to remember a single module import

```
from launch_frontend_py import launch, executable
```

Collapsed the contents of `action.py` in to `__init__.py` to simplify the handling of `__all__` for that toplevel module.
Added `make_valid_name` to handle the underscore suffixing, so it's done the same way both places it's used.
Made the import unit tests a bit more complete.

Signed-off-by: Emerson Knapp <emerson.b.knapp@gmail.com>

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Add basic usage to readme (#15)

Signed-off-by: Emerson Knapp <emerson.b.knapp@gmail.com>

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Enable Python reserved names in Action attributes (#12)

Closes #6

This enables the condition attribute of the base Action class, which is if in YAML/XML, but that's a Python language keyword.

To handle this generally, instead suffix any reserved word with _, so it looks like

executable(cmd='echo hello', if_='True')

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message: Add a unit test for an actual loaded launchfile (#11)

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Rename to launch_frontend_py (#9)

Noted in ROS 2 PMC meeting that the name might indicate a "reimplementation of the launch system in Python", per that something like launch-rs or launch-js might indicate. This new name launch_frontend_py is much harder to misinterpret.

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Handle positional list arg as `children` (#7)

Allow passing positional args, either as individual items or lists, for children entities to `Entity`
